Most signs of Marden-Walker syndrome present in the neonatal period. Disease course is characterized by failure to thrive and psychomotor retardation. Mental retardation generally remains severe, whereas contractures are not progressive and decrease with advancing age and physiotherapy. The Human Phenotype Ontology provides the following lis
